findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of a contract is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially causing unintended behavior.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract owner has elevated privileges and can change max transaction percentage to zero, potentially leading to unauthorized script upgrades.

findings.title: Unsecured external function calls
findings.description: The contracts IDEXFactory and IBEP20 contain unsecured external function calls.

findings.title: Lack of access control for critical functions
findings.description: The contract does not have proper access control mechanisms to restrict unauthorized access to critical functions.

findings.title: Unvalidated user input
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in transfer and transferFrom functions
findings.description: A reentrancy vulnerability exists in the transfer and transferFrom functions, allowing an attacker to drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unprotected approval and allowance functions
findings.description: The approve and allowance functions are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of allowances.

findings.title: Insecure use of txLimit
findings.description: The smart contract owner can change the max transaction percentage without any threshold, potentially setting it to zero.

findings.title: Unprotected setTxLimit function
findings.description: The smart contract owner can change the max transaction percentage without any threshold, potentially leading to security risks.

findings.title: Insecure use of fees
findings.description: The takeFee function has an insecure use of fees which can lead to potential asset loss or manipulation.

findings.title: Unprotected setFees function
findings.description: The setFees function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected setIsDividendExempt function
findings.description: The setIsDividendExempt function lacks access control, allowing unauthorized users to modify dividend exemption settings.

findings.title: Unprotected setIsFeeExempt function
findings.description: The setIsFeeExempt function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes.

findings.title: Unprotected setIsTxLimitExempt function
findings.description: The setIsTxLimitExempt function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected setSwapBackSettings function
findings.description: The setSwapBackSettings function is unprotected and can be accessed by unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unprotected setTargetLiquidity function
findings.description: The setTargetLiquidity function is declared as external and lacks access control, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in addLiquidity and swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens functions
findings.description: The contract is vulnerable to reentrancy attacks due to unsecured calls to external contracts in the addLiquidity and swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens functions.

findings.title: Insecure use of WETH
findings.description: The contract uses WETH (Wrapped Ether) without proper security measures.

findings.title: Unprotected deposit function
findings.description: The deposit function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected process function
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unprotected claimDividend function
findings.description: The claimDividend function is unprotected and can be exploited.

findings.title: Insecure use of getUnpaidEarnings function
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Insecure use of getCumulativeDividends function
findings.description: The getCumulativeDividends function is used insecurely.

findings.title: Unprotected addShareholder and removeShareholder functions
findings.description: The addShareholder and removeShareholder functions are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access to modify shareholder information.
